subclassFeature.name: Depths Domain
entries: Among the more superstitious, inland-dwelling folk of Castea, the oceans and seas are things to be feared. According to myth and legend, the seas swallowed up ancient civilizations during the Great Storm, bringing about untold amounts of death and destruction. These people view the gods and clerics of the Depths domain in much the same way: as bringers of ill-fates. However, those who have a closer connection to the seas, such as those who reside on the coasts or islands, recognize that a swift death is only guaranteed if you fail to offer the proper respect. They know that if one offers deference and respect, the waters of the deep will return the gesture. Clerics of the Depths domain embody this dichotomy. They are people to be feared and respected, deliverers of both punishment and bounty. They are people of little patience and infinite wrath, and at the same time, deeply caring and giving souls.

On Castea, clerics of the Depths domain typically worship (TBD), the Ancestor goddess of ill omens and the seas, or another lesser deity of the ocean. These gods of the depths expect of their clerics two things: to warn the masses of the dangers of the sea, and to demonstrate what happens when you disrespect their power. They loathe above all else arrogance and ignorance, and command their clerics to punish such behaviour with the wrath of the waves. Additionally, clerics of this domain will act as stewards and guides for those who wish to go to sea. They will make offerings or sacrifices to their deity to ensure a seafaring crew's safe return, bless ships and other vessels, or even accompany sailing crews to provide safe passage on treacherous journeys.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Depths Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

entries.caption: Depths Domain Spells
rows: {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell fog cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with tridents and nets.

subclassFeature.name: Waters of Life
entries: Also at 1st level, whenever you finish a short rest, if you spent that rest submerged in a body of water (such as a river, lake, pond, or ocean), you may choose one of the following options:

items: All hit die you rolled during the short rest are treated as having rolled their maximum value.
Regain one expended spell slot, the level of which can be no higher than half your proficiency bonus (rounded up).
Cast the {@spell augury} spell without requiring components, expending a spell slot, or having it prepared.

entries: You can only choose each option once before you take a long rest.
Additionally, you are know the approximate direction and distance of any bodies of water within 1 mile of you.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Deep
entries: Starting when you choose this domain at 1st level, you can use your action to touch a willing creature to bless it.
While blessed, the target can breathe underwater, gains a swimming speed equal to its walking speed, and can speak normally and gains darkvision with a range of 60 feet while underwater.
This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Song of the Sea
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to lure your enemies to their inevitable demise. As an action, you present your holy symbol, causing a creature of your choice that you can see within 60ft and that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that can't be {@condition charmed} succeeds on this saving throw automatically. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by you for up to one minute or until it takes damage or fails a saving throw.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target can't take any actions or reactions, has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive any creature other than you, and spends its turn moving up to 10 feet towards you if it is able to. Additionally, if a creature {@condition charmed} this way is within 10 feet of you, it has disadvantage on all saving throws and attacks made against it have advantage. At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Denizen of the Deep
entries: Starting at level 6, you gain a swimming speed of 60 ft. and are always under the effects of your {@subclassFeature Blessing of the Deep|Cleric|PHB|Depths|kacy_castea|1|kacy_castea} feature.

Additionally, you can protect yourself and others with the waters of the deep. As a bonus action, you can touch a willing creature to surround them in a thin layer of cold, swirling, salt water, granting them temporary hit points equal to half your cleric level (rounded up) for up to 8 hours or until you use this feature again. While a creature has these hit points, they also have resistance to cold damage and ignore the negative effects of cold temperatures.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). If you and your target are both underwater, you do not expend a use. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Drown in the Depths
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can use your action to submerge your enemies in a phantasmal ocean. You and each creature you can see within 60 feet of you becomes submerged in a phantasmal ocean, and can only act and move as if they are underwater (i.e. moves according to its swimming speed, perceives its surroundings to be submerged in water, can breathe only if it can breathe underwater, etc.). An unwilling target can make a Constitution saving throw, and on a success is not submerged. An affected creature can repeat this saving throw every 1 minute, ending the effect for itself on a success.

When you take this action, you can also specify a number of affected creatures equal your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to bless. The chosen creatures gain the benefits of your {@subclassFeature Blessing of the Deep|Cleric|PHB|Depths|kacy_castea|1|kacy_castea} feature while they are submerged.

Additionally, as an bonus action on your turn while submerged, you can choose a direction horizontal to you and force any number of submerged creatures to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@dice 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is moved 10 feet in the chosen direction.
This phantasmal ocean lasts for up to ten minutes or until you choose to dismiss it early. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you take a long rest.
